## Description {#details}

Represents a module in a bitcode file.

Definition at line 101 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/bitcode/bitcodereader-h">BitcodeReader.h</a>.

<SectionDefinition>

## Friends

### getBitcodeFileContents {#af91b526d8407e4b8d8cc54d6cbc1ad50}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>friend <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/expected">Expected</a>&lt; <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/bitcodefilecontents">BitcodeFileContents</a> &gt; <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/memorybufferref">MemoryBufferRef</a> Buffer</>}>
Returns the contents of a bitcode file.

This includes the raw contents of the symbol table embedded in the bitcode file. Clients which require a symbol table should prefer to use irsymtab::read instead of this function because it creates a reader for the irsymtab and handles upgrading bitcode files without a symbol table or with an old symbol table.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/bitcode/bitcodereader-h/#l00122">122</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/bitcode/bitcodereader-h">BitcodeReader.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

</SectionDefinition>

### getLazyModule() {#afe66e1a1da43dba262f5d2fa96bfdf75}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>Expected&lt; std::unique&#95;ptr&lt; Module &gt; &gt; BitcodeModule::getLazyModule (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/llvmcontext">LLVMContext</a> &amp; Context, bool ShouldLazyLoadMetadata, bool IsImporting, <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/parsercallbacks">ParserCallbacks</a> Callbacks=&#123;&#125;)</>}>
Read the bitcode module and prepare for lazy deserialization of function bodies.

If ShouldLazyLoadMetadata is true, lazily load metadata as well. If IsImporting is true, this module is being parsed for ThinLTO importing into another module.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/bitcode/bitcodereader-h/#l00143">143</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/bitcode/bitcodereader-h">BitcodeReader.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/bitcode/lib/bitcode/reader/bitcodereader-cpp/#l08531">8531</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/bitcode/lib/bitcode/reader/bitcodereader-cpp">BitcodeReader.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

<SectionDefinition>

## Private Member Functions

### getModuleImpl() {#a141f45690e1ffd6527d530731d65619d}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>Expected&lt; std::unique&#95;ptr&lt; Module &gt; &gt; BitcodeModule::getModuleImpl (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/llvmcontext">LLVMContext</a> &amp; Context, bool MaterializeAll, bool ShouldLazyLoadMetadata, bool IsImporting, <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/parsercallbacks">ParserCallbacks</a> Callbacks=&#123;&#125;)</>}>
Get a lazy one-at-time loading module from bitcode.

This isn&#39;t always used in a lazy context. In particular, it&#39;s also used by <em><a href="#ad91675f9de94dd24bcee05126b1d7aeb">parseModule()</a></em>. If this is truly lazy, then we need to eagerly pull in forward-referenced functions from block address references.


<ParametersList title="Parameters">
<ParametersListItem name="[in] MaterializeAll">Set to <code>true</code> if we should materialize everything.</ParametersListItem>
</ParametersList>

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/bitcode/bitcodereader-h/#l00125">125</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/bitcode/bitcodereader-h">BitcodeReader.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/bitcode/lib/bitcode/reader/bitcodereader-cpp/#l08489">8489</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/bitcode/lib/bitcode/reader/bitcodereader-cpp">BitcodeReader.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

</SectionDefinition>
